tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: I visited the doctor for pregnancy consultation. First day- visited in the noon so obviously she was in a hurry to leave but the receptionist had taken the money so it was an obligation to attend the patient. My concerns were heard of and prescribed some tests. Next Day- Terrible experience at the lab, the gown given to me for wearing was stinking. Somehow I wore that. I had gone early in the morning so it looked like the gowns were not even washed for a considerable time. Next was the disposable sheet on the bed. I expected that it would be discarded to my horror the nurse asked me to lie down on the same.After the tests I was informed doctor has gone on a leave and I should come the next week.So again I had to come back and pay a good amount just to get the reports shown.Third Day- Doctor did not bother to have a look at the reports, ****** said take some medicines we will help you concieve. I expected an explanation but I got a cold reply. Anyways not bothered. Did not visit her again. P.S I am not here  to malign anybody's image. I don't need my money back. ***** Neither am I unhappy with my life or weight, height etc etc . So don't want to hear this stuff too cliched and rude. At least create hygienic conditions for the patients, they are paying a good amount and deserve it.
reply_text:
I have taken your feedback very seriously and have warned the diagnostic center I go to for two hours five days in a weeks, twelve kilometers away from my house, to be more patient friendly. 
Also, I have spoken to you telephonically two weeks back and told you that I am not the owner of the diagnostic center and you have apologized to me for misrepresenting the facts online and have promised to edit your feedback accordingly but have not. 
Firstly, I can’t understand why you had to endure the horrible experience when you could have pointed out the unhygienic condition to the radiologist who owns the place during your ultrasound and that doctor would have taken necessary steps so that you would not have to suffer all the trouble.
#2. It is human for doctors to take leave and if you had clarified with the receptionist, she would not have charged you for the follow-up visit to show the reports after 10 days since I was on leave for a week.
#3. You visited me because  you were anxious to conceive and not because you wanted a pregnancy consultation.
#4. You had come late for your appointment and I had a delivery patient waiting for me twelve kilometers away from the diagnostic center I met you. I was displeased with the receptionist for collecting your consulation fees. What should I have done? Returned the fees back to you, not considering the fact that you had come spending your time and energy to pay a visit to me? 
#5. I did see your reports in detail and still you have written that I did not bother to see your reports. I saw that your thyroid was under-corrected and gave you proper medication and diet to correct the same and do a repeat check after 6 weeks which you did not. This you have yourself admitted in the telephonic conversation you had with me two weeks back.
#6. Your blood reports also showed low fertility values for which I gave you adequate diet, exercise tips and medications. I did not want you to feel low about it and hence did not go into the details of it. Is that what you mean by a cold reply? In that case I promise to myself that next time onward I will not hesitate to call a spade a spade and definitely be more specific. I accept this is a unpardonable mistake from my side.
PS. I cannot understand why you have written a long anonymous review misrepresenting the facts six months after the incident happened. But I would like to say one thing. We are all humans and small mistakes can happen by everyone. By me, the radiologist, the receptionist, the nurse and even by you. Love and understanding for fellow humans and effective communication can make this world a better place to live in.
Peace be with you.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review:
Dr. Aparna is one of those gynac who I would blindly recommend to anyone in B'lore.
I visited her post 9 mths of my wedding , when we were ready to get into a family  planning. On consulting, she told me that I had issue (PCOD) and this may not make me conceive without treatment, but she also explained why PCO's is not a big issue these days as it's very common for every 3rd lady, due to lifestyle, food habits etc. she guided me through what lifestyle I must follow to make things easy + suggested some medicines and test and a small diagnostic surgery, to regularize my  period.  
Most importantly, since she treats you in her own clinic, she takes personal interest in your concerns and address them, unlike doctors in Big hospitals who may not be able to give you a personal attention all throughout. she has lovely staff, who make you feel belonged as well.
Since she was new to me, i was also checking on my treatment with my aunt, who is a gyno (not in B'lore) as well, and i learn the treatment is exactly same what she would have done had she treated me. 
i have conceived and both me and bby is doing great by far. i would blindly recommend Dr. Aparna for any gynac issues with any Lady. you can just trust her, coz she scolds you like a Mom, guides you like a friend and treats you like a professional. :) :) Thanks Dr. Aparna for all the care you have taken till date !
reply_text: Many thanks for your kind words.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Explanation of the health issue,Wait time,
review:
A doctor who knows where she is heading to and build the current foundation accordingly. We went to Doctor few months before my wife conceived and wanted proper guidance and medication. Its been 10-11 months of best of guidance, a happy wife and a sweet little princess. Dr. Aparnaa has played a role of Dietician, Pediatrician and finally a Gynaecologist all the way.

NOTE: She may scold you at times if you go off track, but that's what parents are supposed to do. 

Regarding Amenities: The clinic is right in front of Rainbow Hospital and since we were using Rainbow for our scans it was a perfect pairing. Wait time is never beyond 15-20min. 

Regarding Expectation Setting: Doctor is logical here and doesn't over doze you with medicines and scan schedules. The one thing I liked about the doctor was that in 7th month itself she told us that its going to be a C section delivery and not a normal one. This helped me in plan better (not only financials but call relatives accordingly). 

The last visit: Most of the doctors do set grounds for the next delivery on the last consultation day, but what doctor did was to give a diet chart and some advise on exercise and stay healthy.

Overall Rating: if given a chance to rate the doctor: 5/5.
Amenity: 4.5/5 (too much traffic to tackle)
Reliability: 5/5
reply_text: Thanks for the Vishal feedback

review: My experience with doctor aparna is worst. i visited for my early pregnancy checkup, she didnt even see my scan report, she just said it is normal and didnt suggest me prescription for the baby's growth, she just simply said scan is normal, wotver we ask she says yes, she didnt explain what is the condtion, didnt suggest me what to eat, what not to eat, i recommoned not to consult this doctor
reply_text:
Dear Deepa, 
I am very surprised to see your comments.  Each and every patient who  comes to me for early pregnancy checkup is given folic acid tablets and told specifically that it is for baby brain development.
I firmly tell all my first trimester patients not to eat papaya and pineapple and not to travel in first four months of  pregnancy. Exact reason for the same is also explained to the patient. 
Only after that i advise them for a early pregnancy scan to check for viability and location of pregnancy.
In your case,  ur first visit was on the 30th of June and only after u were convinced with my first consultation, u did ur early pregnancy  scan in a nearby diagnostic center and then again met me on the 3rd with ur early pregnacy scan report.  U were 6 weeks 3 days by dates and also 6 weeks by scan.  It was a viable pregnacy with no subchorionic haemorrhage and hence I said that it was a normal scan report. 
U must have read well online and since the answers to ur questions were yes, i answered yes. I have spent adequate time with u in both ur visits to my clinic. 
I am also in regular touch with my patients over whatsapp and their remaining doubts are answered.
Perhaps it is unfair on your part to malign my reputation online. 
Please feel free to come over to my clinic for another explanation of your condition.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Aparna ma’am was very clear with her communication and advice both preconception and through the course of pregnancy leading up to the delivery.
We approached her for conception and normal delivery with me having PCOS. She helped me overcome the difficulties accompanying PCOS and with the help of ma’am we conceived within 2-3 months of approaching her.
She was helpful, supportive and strict (in the right way) throughout my pregnancy and helped me maintain my weight and blood sugar through timely advice and medicine. Due to her positive, friendly and confident nature, every visit was both uplifting and helpful.
Even when it came to the timing of delivery she was very decisive, she took an important decision to induce labor at 38 weeks when my BP had started rising and my baby was ready. Thanks to her, I am now a proud mother of a healthy boy delivered normally.
Thank you ma’am for everything. We really are very fortunate to have found you as our gyno.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: ** ****** ***** ** ** ***** **** ** *** ***. Right from the start of pregnancy she gave best advice and cleared any doubts we had as a first time parents. Her clinic has all the necessary arrangements for routine tests and check ups (as well as blood/urine sample collection facility). I had a few complications  sine start but during a routine scan in 5th month, I was detected with cervical imcompetence and the Radiologist directed me go and see my Gynecologist immediately. I met Dr Aparna the same day, she explained me the medical condition in easy comprehensible manner and all possible treatment options along with their effectiveness and possible side effects. On same night she conducted Cervical Cerclage surgery. After that, I was adviced strict bed rest by her until delivery. She can read her patients apprehensions and addresses them very tactfully. Finally I had a normal delivery and I am glad I adhered to all she told me to.

review:
I had PCOD condition when i first met Dr. Aparna. I was worried whether i will be able to bear a child. But with her help i was able to get pregnant in the second month itself since medication. Without any issues i delivered a healthy baby.

Doctor was very friendly and first made us understand what is cervical encirclage and why a cervical stitch was required for my wife.
We asked her a lot of questions some of us made us feel really silly.
But the doctor encouraged us to ask all sorts of doubts and then explained each answer in detail.
She told us what to expect, and what precautions will be required even if we put the stitch. She even gave us an option of how not to go for the stitch and still manage the issue.
But we were very scared and to be on the safer side opted for the stitch.
After the operation, my wife was kept in observation for two days and then sent home. Dr Aparnaa kept in touch with  my wife and via whatsapp. 
Now 2 weeks are over post the cervical stich and my wife is doing very well.

We thank Dr Aparna for her commitment towards my wife's care.

While she took a lot of precautionary measures to take this pregnancy to term and avoid complications, she never recommended any unwanted test or scan. She was very considerate and friendly throughout and kept pepping us up, citing examples from her experiences. Throughout my pregnancy, she kept encouraging me for a normal delivery. Unfortunately, due to a medical emergency at the last minute, I had to undergo a C-Section, but I'm positive that  Aparnaa ma'am wouldn't do it unless there's a real medical need for it, given the ethical woman that she is! I'd be lying if I say I wasn't disappointed initially, but the fact that she's with you through the period of pain helps in quick healing and normalcy restoration. Just trust her line of treatment 100%, and be rest assured that all will be well.
I wish Aparnaa ma'am the very best in her personal & professional life!

Varuna

review: I started visiting aparna panda for pregnancy check up .From the first visit I found her very friendly and felt very comfortable .She will not suggest any unnecessary scans or medicines .I believed her from beginning and she always kept her trust .I was admitted to rainbow hospital for delivery and she waited 30 hrs to do normal delivery unfortunately I had to go for c sec.But I thank her for all the effort she did and helping us to have bundle of joy 😊I feel lucky to meet her .She always have given us adequate time when ever we visited her and always have been passed positive vibes .Thank you so much mam .you will always be remembered throughout my life.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I and my wife went through a lot of reviews about quite a few Gynaecologists across Bangalore and finally we decided to visit Dr. Aparnaa Panda. I must say we have been rightfully happy with our decision. The moment you visit her, the first medicine she will probably prescribe is a dose of positivity. Though we were married for more than 2 years, it was around 6-8 months that we were trying to conceive when we decided to consult Dr. Aparnaa. The very next month, my wife tested positive! She has never prescribed unnecessary medicines and tests in our case; of course that will be different from case to case depending on the complexity of the pregnancy. She has always been very friendly and does cheerfully clarify all your doubts. We are in fourth month of our pregnancy, and we fervently believe that next 5 to 6 months will be a great and pleasant association with her. Here is conveying sincere gratitude to Dr. Aparnaa from two young "to be parents".
reply_text:
Many thanks for the encouragement. will be more energetic to treat and heal patients the whole month thanks to your feedback. 
The young to be parents think positive themselves, hence the intense positive feedback.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr.aparna panda, to start with, is a very kind and compassionate doctor. We consulted dr.aparna when my wife got concieved and now I am a happy father. My wife had several complaints and concerns which were patiently resolved by dr.panda. She is so service oriented that most of the time in case if we were out of station we would get in touch with her through whatsapp or phone and seek guidance from her. My wife got admitted with severe vomiting and diarrhea and was found that she was already in labour. Dr.panda was kind enough to wait almost one whole day before my baby was born through normal delivery. Hatts off to her patience. I would definitely recommend her to my family and friends who are looking to deliver naturally😊
reply_text: Many thanks for your strong recommendation.

review: The doctor is not easy to talk to and I felt imposed upon during our conversation. She also seemed to be in a hurry to finish the consultation. The doctor was inflexible in that she did not look at the digital copy of the blood reports and told us to come again with hard copies.
reply_text:
Sorry if your felt that i was in a hurry. ( In a hurry for what? I did not have a busy OPD ). I remember having spent a lot of time on you trying to dispel the different myths and misconceptions that were planted in your mind by your layman friend about family planning methods.
I take this opportunity to tell all my future and present patients that I will not  see digital copy of their reports. This is already displayed in my clinic and you should not have paid my consultation in the counter before you entered my room if you consider me inflexible.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I had miscarriage 1 month back and that was abroad. When I returned back to India I reached out to Aparna panda but she didn't even pay attention to my medical history and just diverted the whole point by stating I never had miscarriage which I had suffered and I have all the med documents for the same. I think she need to listen to her patient as when we reach out to a doctor ** **** ****** **********
reply_text:
Dear Patient,
I am extremely sorry to know that u had an unpleasant experience.
I am sure there is some misunderstanding her. Because I take a long time to review my patients past records. How is it possible that in ur records, there has been a miscarriage and I say that there hasn't been? 
For a miscarriage to have occurred, there should be a simple urine pregnancy positive report or a positive BHCG report or an ultrasound report saying that u were pregnant. 
If u have just missed ur periods but preg test is negative, then it might be just a case of irregular cycles. 
If at all I have told you that you were not pregnant and it was due to abnormal hormones that u have not got your cycles, I must have given you my true opinion on your condition. 
How can you judge me based on what you think is right? Please don't judge me based on what you think is right. Rather you should judge me on my honest opinion based on my experience. 
I don't know when and where I have met u since u have chosen to remain anonymous.

tags: Value for money,
review: We didn’t get our follow up as repots came in evening and the other days doctor was on leave for 3-4 days. When we asked receptionist when we can come for followup and is it chargeable then they said as your followup is not done you can come at anytime and when we went after 10days as we booked our followup prior for that day they asked us to pay for consultation again. Bad experience
reply_text:
Despite loosing an important family member of my household to death, I had been visiting electronic City which is 15kms from my house alternate days so that patients who need me don't suffer. I never took leave for 4to 5 days at a stretch and I can show u my calendar data at any time. 
I had already explained to u that and told you to Whatsapp me the report which you did and I advised you what to do too. 
Instead of thanks, you come after 12 days with a new problem(your old problem was cured) and expect to be seen free of cost. 
I am still ready to do charity, but do you expect the diagnostic center where I work to run at a loss?
I regret seeing thankless patients like you and don't recommend any doctor to see a patient with such cheap mentality as yours.
The receptionists never give false reasurrances like this. Our follow up guidelines are clearly demonstrated at the reception and also in the registration form which you have duly signed.
And you are not a young adolescent, you are a working lady so please no sympathies for young ladies like you.

review: Very bad.for one min I have paid 450 rs.doctor was nt poliet and not understanding what we had told.it was very much dispointing.please dnt visit her as she collects reg fee and consultence fee1st.
reply_text:
Very sorry to know that there was a communication gap between both of us. It could have been sorted out if you were bold enough to tell me rather than resorting to an anonymous feedback.
It is unfair to state that I have spent only one minute of my time on you. Usually, I spend more than 10 mins even for my followup Patients.
My clinic consultation (Rs400) and one time registration charges (Rs 50) is clearly displayed and all charges are collected upfront to avoid unnecessary surprises later on.
For those who cannot afford them, I also give free consultation on Practo and other platforms whenever I have the time.

tags: Value for money,Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,Pregnant,Pregnant Women Counseling,Maternal Care/ Checkup,Pregnancy Tests,
review: Feel, dr is rude in nature and  not for serving people, and she doesn't want to spent time with patients.
reply_text:
Despite coming without appointment on a busy Sunday afternoon, I have seen your wife and also done her early pregnancy ultrasound because she had lower abdomen pain and also given relevant advise as is evident in my prescription.
We hope not to see thankless people like you.
Sorry this is not a free clinic and just because we charge our patient consultation and ultrasound charges,  does it mean that we are not for serving the patients?

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,
review: Not satisfied at all. She needs to be little friendly. I couldn't even discuss half of my problems with her because she had that " I am not interested face " on. Disappointed. Now I will have to visit someone else for my same problem.
reply_text:
A little friendly? I cross all barriers between a doctor patient relationship and am more than extra friendly with all patients. But I will not encourage promiscuous behaviour.
If i need to be friendly, perhaps you need to tell what is your problem if you want correct treatment my dear. After all you have paid for your consultation. 
My face? It is the same as what is shown in the photos in practo and if you did not like it, you should not have booked your appointment with me in the first place.
Basically, tell me how many people have satisfied you till now?
